ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The physical magnitude of something._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
